subjectCategories: Lunar and Planetary Science and Exploration
title: 106 Co-Signatories of the Planetary Science and Astrobiology Decadal Survey 2023-2032 White Paper
abstract:
The field of exoplanetary science has emerged over the past two decades, rising up alongside traditional solar system planetary science. Both fields focus on understanding the processes which form and sculpt planets through time, yet there has been less scientific exchange between the two communities than is ideal. I will report on our white paper which explores
some of the institutional and cultural barriers impeding cross-discipline collaborations. Our suggestions for fostering greater collaboration between the disciplines will be described. Some solutions require structural or policy changes within NASA itself, while others are directed towards other institutions, including academic publishers, that can also facilitate
greater interdisciplinarity.

organization.name: American Astronomical Society
organization.location: Washington D.C., District of Columbia, United States

meetings.name: DPS2020. 52nd Annual Meeting of the Division for Planetary Sciences
